clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention and Treatment With Calcifediol of COVID-19 Induced Acute Respiratory Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention and Treatment With Calcifediol of COVID-19 Coronavirus-induced Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS)

lead_sponsor.agency: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

collaborator.agency: Junta de Andalucía - Consejería de Salud y Familias

clinical_study.source: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

brief_summary.textblock:
The administration of Calcifediol in patients with COVID-19, will reduce the development of SARS and the worsening of the various phases of the syndrome. Reducing at least 25% in ICU admission and death from the process, reducing days of hospitalization, facilitating the recovery of the same, acting significantly and positively, in any of its phases throughout the natural history of illness.
As a treatment with extensive experience of clinical use, safe, inexpensive, and potentially very effective, it will have a highly efficient cost-benefit impact on the prevention of SARS.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects who enter the Intensive Care Unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from onset of symptoms to discharge of patients in conventional hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the time (in days) at discharge in newly hospitalized patients on non-invasive ventilation.
In patients who, in the course of their evolution, required admission with mechanical ventilation in the ICU, time until admission to Intensive Care Unit

secondary_outcome.measure: ICU - Time mechanical ventilation is removed
secondary_outcome.description: In patients who, in the course of their evolution, required admission with mechanical ventilation in the ICU, time until mechanical ventilation is removed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the inflammatory markers related with the disease
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the inflammatory markers related to IL disease. Blood samples will be collected and assessed in order to evaluate interleukins related with the interleukin storm using immunological tests.
Evaluation of the Vitamin D metabolites.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution in the Sat O2/FiO2 ratio.
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the evolution in the Sat O2/FiO2 ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution in the degree of dyspnea
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the evolution in the degree of dyspnea using the analog Borg scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of the improvement of radiological findings by simple radiology
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the evolution of radiological findings by simple radiology in the recruited subjects since their beginning in the trial until they end the trial
Incidence of adverse events related to medication and its administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Appearance of hemorrhagic or thrombotic phenomena
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence in the appearance of hemorrhagic or thrombotic phenomena.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 and < 90 years
- PCR confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19
- Radiological image compatible with inflammatory pleuropulmonary exudate
- Signature of direct or delegated informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Being treated with Calcifediol or Cholecalciferol in any of its presentations and dosages
- Intolerance or allergy to Calcifediol or its components
- Pregnancy
